message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a learning framework for text classification, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of a selector and classifier, which are machine learning techniques, indicating that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of data aggregation to improve the robustness of the classifier, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with text classification, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR), making cs.IR another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as text classification is often used in image captioning and other computer vision tasks.
